p: In traditional medicine, the leaves of R. officinalis L. are used based on their antibacterial activities [ 51], carminative [ 9, 38, 52] and as analgesic in muscles and joints [ 38–40, 53]. Also, rosemary's essential oils and extracts obtained from flowers and leaves are used to treat minor wounds, rashes, headache, dyspepsia, circulation problems, but also as an expectorant, diuretic and antispasmodic in renal colic [ 38–40, 48].
